sentences.english: That the voice is greatly some, ask for to come to the monk's upset attention in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 那声音有些大，惹来了庙里和尚的不悦的注目。

sentences.english: They made unpleasant insinuations that he might not be quite honest.
sentences.chinese: 他们作出令人不悦的暗示说他可能不很老实。

sentences.english: If the people of Yan will not be pleased with your taking possession of it, then do not do so.
sentences.chinese: 取之而燕民不悦，则勿取。

sentences.english: Tinas car and car close beside, displeasure, waiting for the owner.
sentences.chinese: 天娜的车和旁边的车停得很近，不悦，等待车主。

sentences.english: In the scow , the cowering fowl scowled at the howling owl.
sentences.chinese: 在平底驳船里，畏缩的家禽对嚎叫的猫头鹰面露不悦。

sentences.english: His mother scowled at him when she saw his score report.
sentences.chinese: 看到他的成绩单时，她母亲一脸不悦地看着他。

sentences.english: Wouldst thou wish to please a man who does not please himself?
sentences.chinese: 你希望取悦于一个对自己也感到不悦的人吗？

sentences.english: "BE?"Peeping out one silk in the farmland great eye is upset.
sentences.chinese: “是吗？”田宏眼中露出了一丝不悦。

sentences.english: He mugged displeasure at the suggestion.
sentences.chinese: 他对那个建议皱了一下眉头表示不悦。

sentences.english: Pride engraves his frowns in stones, love offers her surrender in flowers.
sentences.chinese: 矝傲将不悦镌于顽石，爱情的悦服献自花朵。

sentences.english: His rudeness offended every one in the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 他的粗鲁无礼令餐馆中的所有人感到不悦。

sentences.english: He pushed out his lips in displeasure.
The president is upset that the press second-guesses his new policy.
sentences.chinese: 总统对舆论界猜测他的新政策感到不悦。

sentences.english: Selfishness displeases the Lord, therefore he also was killed.
sentences.chinese: 他的自私使上帝大为不悦，因此也叫他死了。

definition: variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
